ab.title: Numbers 30
ab.l: And Moses told the children of Israelall that the Lord commanded Moses.Parashat Matot
And Moses spoketo the superiors of the tribes of the childrenof Israel, saying, ‘This is the word which the Lord has commanded.
A man who vows a vow to the Lord orswears an oath to bind his soul with a bond:he shall not disregard his word, he shall do according to all that comes out of his mouth.
And a woman who vows a vow to the Lordand binds |herself by| a bond in her father’s house in her youth,
And her father hears her vowand her bond by which she has bound her soul, andher father keeps quiet to her, then all her vows will stand, and everybond by which she has bound her soul will stand.
Butif her father forbids her on the day he heard all her vowsand all her bonds by which she has bound her soul,it will not stand. And the Lord will forgive her sin because her father forbadeit her.
And if she marries a husband,and her vows are on her orthe utterance of her lips by which she bound her soul,
And her husband heard it and kept quiet to her on the day that he heard it,then her vows will stand, and her bonds by which she boundher soul will stand.
But ifher husband forbade her on the day that he heard it and brokeher vow which is on her and the utterance of her lipsby which she bound her soul, then the Lord will forgiveher.
And a vow of a widow and of her that is divorced, everythingby which she has bound her soul, shall stand against her.
And if she vowed in her husband’s houseor bound her soul by a bond with an oath,
And her husband heard it and kept quiet to her,did not forbid her, then all her vows will stand, and every bondby which she bound her soul will stand.

Butif her husband has truly broken them on the day he heard them,then all the came out of her lips concerning her vows and concerning her bond of her soulwill not stand. Her husband has broken them, and the Lord will forgiveher sin.
Every vow and every binding oath to afflictthe soul: her husband establishes it or her husband breaksit.

But if her husband altogether keeps quiet to herfrom day to day, then he establishes all her vowsor all her bonds which are on her.He establishes them, because he kept quiet to her on the day he heard them.
But if he truly breaks them after that he has heard them,then he will bear the punishment of the women.’
These are the statutes which the Lord commandedMoses, between a man and his wife, between the fatherand his daughter while she is in her youth within her father’s house.
